Name: Blinker (Hawksmoor's Riff)
Ingredients: 60 ml Straight rye whiskey (100 proof /50% alc./vol.)
7.5 ml Sugar syrup 'rich' (2 sugar to 1 water, 65.0Â°Brix)
Instructions: Select and pre-chill a Coupe glass .
Prepare garnish of lemon zest twist.
MUDDLE raspberries in base of shaker.
EXPRESS lemon zest twist over the cocktail and use as garnish.
Review: The original Blinker from Patrick Gavin Duffy's 1934 The Official Mixer's Manual uses grenadine but the folk at Hawksmoor have switched this for a few fresh raspberries and a dash of sugar syrup, turning a good drink into a great cocktail.
History: Adapted from a recipe discovered in 2013 at Hawksmoor in Spitalfields, London, England.
